title: Getting into a live-in while already being in one will attract up to 7 yrs‚Äô jail: U‚Äôkhand UCC
content: Uttarakhand's Uniform Civil Code (Amendment) Ordinance introduces stringent penalties, including up to seven years imprisonment, for offences related to marriage and live-in relationships. The amendments aim to clarify provisions, enhance effectiveness, and strengthen citizen rights, incorporating stricter punishment clauses following the implementation of new criminal laws.

title: Blue drum murders: A chilling pattern of spousal betrayal and brutal killings
content: A gruesome murder in Meerut, involving a body sealed in a blue drum, has sparked a wave of similar crimes across multiple states. These cases highlight patterns of domestic betrayal, third-party involvement, and extreme methods used to conceal murder, leaving investigators and the public deeply uneasy.

title: Denied access to funeral ground, Dalits light pyre on Bihar road
content: Dalit villagers in Bihar's Vaishali were allegedly prevented from using the local cremation ground, forcing them to cremate a 91-year-old woman on a public road. The incident, which occurred in Sondho-Vashudeo village, has sparked tensions and prompted an official inquiry into the alleged discrimination.

title: Trichy bus driver slaps passenger multiple times for asking him to avoid rash driving
content: A private bus driver in Trichy was arrested after assaulting a passenger who requested him to slow down due to rash driving. The incident, captured on video, escalated into a physical altercation at the bus stand. The driver faces charges including voluntarily causing hurt and criminal intimidation.

title: Nvidia H-1B data reveals US pay as Jensen Huang reviews all compensation
content: Nvidia's soaring stock has created millionaires among its employees, with H-1B visa filings revealing substantial base salaries for critical roles. While CEO Jensen Huang emphasizes personal involvement in compensation, earlier hires have significantly benefited from equity appreciation. The data offers a glimpse into the pay for engineers, architects, researchers, and product managers, excluding bonuses and equity.

title: No one from my family will attend Sunetra‚Äôs oath-taking ceremony: Sharad Pawar
content: Sharad Pawar expressed surprise regarding Sunetra Pawar's oath-taking ceremony, stating he was neither consulted nor informed. He confirmed no family members would attend, attributing the decision to party leaders Sunil Tatkare and Praful Patel. Pawar learned of Sunetra's selection as deputy chief minister through news reports, emphasizing it was an internal party matter.

title: Triple murder: Man kills parents, sister, buries bodies in rented house
content: A shocking triple murder has rocked Kottur, where a man, Akshay Kumar, allegedly killed his parents and sister. The victims were reportedly buried within their rented home. Akshay later filed a missing persons report in Bengaluru, attempting to mislead authorities. He confessed to the crime during police interrogation. The motive remains unclear as investigations continue.

title: ‚ÄòThere‚Äôs a different route‚Äô: Google CEO shares photo of Alex Honnold climbing Taipei 101
content: Climber Alex Honnold achieved a historic feat by free-soloing Taiwan's Taipei 101 skyscraper.  He ascended the 508-meter building without ropes or safety gear.  The climb took about an hour and a half.  Google CEO Sundar Pichai shared photos of the event.  Honnold is known for his daring climbs.

title: 22-year-old crushed to death by concrete slab while shooting reel in Bareilly
content: A 22-year-old barber, Mohd Faizan, tragically died while filming a social media reel near an under-construction flyover in Bareilly. He fell from a support wall and a concrete slab collapsed on him. Rescuers took nearly half an hour to remove the debris, by which time Faizan was pronounced dead.

title: Pat Cummins ruled out of T20 World Cup; Australia announce squad
content: Australia faces a blow as Pat Cummins is out of the T20 World Cup 2026 due to injury. Mitchell Marsh will lead the 15-member squad, with Ben Dwarshuis and Matthew Renshaw drafted in as replacements.  Selectors praised their pace, fielding, and batting versatility, anticipating their value in the tournament's conditions.

title: Foul air causing deaths? ‚ÄòYes‚Äô, ‚Äòcan‚Äôt say‚Äô: 2 govt arms take differing stands
content: Divergent views from governmental bodies regarding air pollution are creating waves. The Environment Ministry argues that there's a lack of decisive evidence tying pollution to actual deaths, while the Indian Council of Medical Research puts forth alarming statistics, claiming over 1.2 million fatalities in 2017 due to air quality issues.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai introduces Genie AI app
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai announced Project Genie, an experimental AI tool from Google DeepMind that allows users to create and explore interactive digital worlds from text prompts. Powered by Genie 3, Nano Banana Pro, and Gemini, the tool generates worlds in real-time, simulating physics and interactions.

title: Right-wing group vows to block rebuilding of Bulleh Shah shrine
content: A right-wing group, Kali Sena, has threatened to oppose the reconstruction of Sufi poet Bulleh Shah's mazaar in Mussoorie, vowing to build a Hanuman temple instead. This follows vandalism of the mazaar and protests by Bajrang Dal activists. Congress leaders have urged police action against the threats.

title: Alzheimer‚Äôs hits women harder: Can omega-3 turn the tide?
content: Women face a higher risk of Alzheimer's disease. Omega-3 fatty acids, found in fish and supplements, are crucial for brain health and may help prevent cognitive decline. This is particularly important for women in developing nations who encounter numerous challenges in accessing healthcare. Nutrition-focused interventions, alongside broader support systems, are vital for their well-being.

title: Ghaziabad stabbing: 2 killed over delay in serving food at eatery near Khoda police station; 4 detained
content: A fatal stabbing incident near Khoda police station on January 30 resulted in two deaths and one injury. Police responded to a scuffle and found three injured individuals. Two succumbed to their injuries during treatment. The third injured person is stable. An investigation is ongoing, and some individuals have been detained for questioning.

title: Indian football: ISL clubs ask for relegation to be paused for 3-5 years; request stability
content: Indian Super League (ISL) clubs have written to the Joint Secretary of the Sports Ministry and requested that relegation be scrapped for three to five seasons, considering the difficult circumstances prevailing in India's top division. The clubs have asked that the upcoming season be considered a "virtual force majeure."

title: 'Ajit left us before ... ': Sharad Pawar's big NCP merger remark ahead of Sunetra's oath
content: Sharad Pawar revealed merger talks between NCP factions were advanced before Ajit Pawar's death, aiming to fulfill his nephew's wish. He denied prior knowledge of Sunetra Pawar's potential deputy CM role, stating decisions are made in Mumbai without his consultation. Pawar also dismissed speculation about joining the NDA.

title: No work, no school, no shopping: Protests sweep US against Trump‚Äôs immigration crackdown
content: Across the US, widespread strikes and protests erupted Friday against the Trump administration's immigration policies, fueled by outrage over recent killings during enforcement actions. Businesses shuttered, schools saw walkouts, and citizens gathered in city centers, demanding an end to what organizers called "ICE's reign of terror." Demonstrations spanned coast to coast, highlighting deep-seated anger and fear.

title: 'Begged billions': 'Ashamed' Shehbaz laments Pakistan's chronic debt dilemma
content: Pakistan's prime minister Shehbaz Sharif revealed a difficult truth. He and Army Chief Asim Munir sought billions in loans from friendly nations. This was done quietly to bridge the country's external financing gap. Sharif acknowledged the compromises involved in seeking such aid. China was a key supporter. Pakistan has a history of relying on the IMF for financial support.

title: Bank holidays in February 2026: When and where will banks remain closed
content: Planning a bank visit in February 2026? Be aware of closures in Sikkim on Feb 18 for Losar, Maharashtra on Feb 19 for Shivaji Jayanti, and Mizoram/Arunachal Pradesh on Feb 20 for State Day. Remember, banks also close on the second and fourth Saturdays. Digital services remain active for your convenience.

title: 'If team management replaces Sanju Samson with Ishan Kishan ... ': Ex-India star speaks out
content: Sanju Samson faces immense pressure in the final T20I against New Zealand, needing a strong performance to silence critics amid a lean patch. Former player Irfan Pathan advocates for Samson's consistent batting order placement, while also highlighting the importance of players like Tilak Varma for team balance and temperament.

title: 'Bit her face, hands and legs': CCTV captures horrific dog attack in Bengaluru
content: A morning walk turned terrifying for Shalini Dubey in HSR Layout when a dog attacked her, causing facial and neck injuries. Her husband filed a complaint against the owner, Amaresh Reddy, for negligence. Police have booked Reddy under relevant sections of the BNS for allowing his pet to roam freely, leading to the unprovoked assault.

title: Digital life, real heart risk: How to keep heart safe in 24/7 non-stop world
content: Our constant screen use is a hidden health threat. It leads to physical problems like high blood pressure and heart issues. This stress builds up slowly, often unnoticed. Experts warn that this digital strain affects sleep, movement, and overall well-being. Awareness is low because the danger feels ordinary. Simple changes can protect your heart.

title: Retired Air Force officer shot by unidentified assailants at Lucknow restaurant
content: A retired Indian Air Force officer, Awadhesh Kumar Pathak, was critically injured after being shot by two unidentified assailants at his restaurant in Lucknow. The incident occurred Friday night, with the victim sustaining a bullet wound. Police are investigating all possible angles, including personal enmity and business rivalry, and are reviewing CCTV footage to identify the attackers.

title: 'Nahi khelenge': India-Pakistan T20 World Cup final faces shock twist
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Rashid Latif feels Pakistan acted late on the T20 World Cup 2026 issue. The Pakistan Cricket Board awaits government clearance for participation.  Latif suggests the window for a significant protest has closed.  Pakistan's squad departure is scheduled, indicating participation.  A final decision is expected soon.

title: Inside CJ Roy's luxury car collection: 12 Rolls-Royce, Bugatti, Lamborghinis
content: Real estate tycoon CJ Roy has died. His family blames income tax officials from Kerala for his death. Roy, owner of Confident Group, was under investigation. He had a large social media following. His last post was for Republic Day. The family is expected to arrive in Bengaluru soon. Investigations into the circumstances are ongoing.

title: India-US trade deal: Piyush Goyal shares update; ‚Äòevery country has to‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal expressed no disappointment over delays in the India-US trade deal, emphasizing that each nation prioritizes its interests. He confirmed ongoing friendly negotiations, suggesting a potential conclusion this year.  Goyal highlighted India's commitment to fair trade and safeguarding its economic sensitivities, even as it pursues other FTAs.

title: Declare cow ‚Äòrajya mata‚Äô, ban beef export in 40 days: Hindu seer dares UP CM Yogi
content: Swami Avimukteshwaranand has challenged Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath to declare the cow 'state mother' and ban beef exports within 40 days. Failure to do so, he warned, will lead to saints gathering in Lucknow on March 11 to label the CM a 'fake Hindu'. The seer emphasized cow protection and dharma as true tests of being Hindu.

title: 'Border 2' marches towards Rs 350 crore mark worldwide
content: Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' continues its box office dominance, crossing Rs 300 crore worldwide within its first week. Despite a slight dip on weekdays, the film collected Rs 11 crore on its eighth day, heading towards the Rs 350 crore mark. The war drama has garnered Rs 235.25 crore net in India and Rs 322.5 crore globally.

title: Nayanthara reacts to best actress award win
content: Nayanthara has been honored with the Tamil Nadu State Film Award for Best Actress for her impactful role in 'Aramm'. The actress expressed her gratitude, calling the win 'blessed'. Her production banner lauded her powerful portrayal. Additionally, her film 'Netrikann' received a special prize for women empowerment, and her produced film 'Koozhangal' won Best Film.

title: Doctor explains the strange pattern of pain that waits for the lights to go off
content: Nighttime pain is a common experience, often dismissed as a nuisance. However, this persistent discomfort can signal underlying health conditions. Experts explain that rest at night can worsen pain from muscle and joint degeneration, nerve issues, or gastrointestinal problems. Persistent nighttime pain, especially with other symptoms, requires medical attention. Ignoring this pain means the body's signals go unheard.

title: India to buy oil from Venezuela instead of Russia? US pitch to counter 25% tariffs
content: The US has permitted India to resume Venezuelan oil purchases, aiming to reduce its reliance on Russian crude. This move is part of a broader US strategy to redirect India's energy imports away from Russia amidst growing pressure and trade costs. India is set to significantly cut Russian crude imports in the coming months, diversifying its supply sources.

title: Budget 2026 on February 1: Will NSE, BSE remain open for trading on Sunday?
content: Indian stock markets will operate on Sunday, February 1, 2026, for the Union Budget presentation, a rare occurrence. Both BSE and NSE confirmed normal trading hours, with only specialized sessions like T+0 settlement suspended. This marks the first Sunday Budget presentation since 2000, while the year's holiday schedule remains unchanged.

title: Pawar play: Speedy decision on Sunetra as deputy CM to pre-empt takeover by NCP (SP)?
content: Sunetra Pawar's appointment as deputy chief minister is a strategic move by senior NCP leaders to preemptively quell leadership speculation following her husband's passing. This decision, endorsed by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, aims to stabilize the political landscape before the potential merger of NCP factions, ensuring control amidst potential demands from Sharad Pawar's camp.

title: WWE Royal Rumble 2026 start time, match card, venue, date and how to watch
content: WWE Royal Rumble 2026 is set for a historic debut in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, featuring two namesake Rumble matches and a blockbuster Undisputed WWE Championship bout. AJ Styles faces a career-threatening match against Gunther, while Roman Reigns and Brock Lesnar are confirmed for the men's Rumble. The event promises surprise returns and debuts, making it a must-watch spectacle.

title: Bengaluru police inspector caught taking Rs 4 lakh bribe, video goes viral
content: A police inspector, Govindaraju, was caught accepting a Rs 4 lakh bribe in Bengaluru. A video surfaced showing him resisting arrest by Lokayukta officials. He allegedly demanded Rs 5 lakh to help a complainant in a cheating case, having already received Rs 1 lakh prior.

title: Giants co-owner Tisch named in latest Epstein file...
content: Giants co-owner Steve Tisch's name appears at least 440 times among millions of documents in the latest release of Jeffrey Epstein files Friday, including some that show Epstein connected him to numerous women.

content: The Seattle Seahawks will go up for sale after Super Bowl LX, league and ownership sources familiar with the arrangement tell ESPN.

title: Jokic returns from injury to net 31 in Nuggets' wi...
content: Nikola Jokic returned to the Nuggets' lineup on Friday night after being sidelined since Dec. 29 with a bone bruise in his hyperextended left knee and had 31 points and 12 rebounds in a 122-109 win over the LA Clippers.

title: Unrivaled draws record crowd of 21,490 in Philly
content: Unrivaled co-founder Napheesa Collier said it was "unbelievable" to see a record 21,490 fans attend the 3-on-3 league's inaugural tour stop in Philadelphia.

title: Draymond: Not losing sleep as Giannis talk swirls
content: As reports swirl over a potential Giannis-to-Golden State trade, Draymond Green said he has "no reason to sit and worry" about his Warriors future but also said he understands trades are part of the business.

title: Sources: Ravens to hire Doyle, 29, to be new OC
content: The Ravens are hiring Bears offensive coordinator Declan Doyle as their offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter. Doyle, 29, will be the youngest offensive playcaller in the NFL.

title: Wilson, A's reach agreement on 7-year extension
content: All-Star shortstop Jacob Wilson and the Athletics reached agreement on a seven-year contract that includes a club option for an eighth season, the team announced Friday.

title: Robertson, 40, WS champion with Yankees, retires
content: David Robertson, who recorded 179 saves over a 17-year major league career, announced his retirement Friday.

content: The incident occurred around 8.10 a.m. at the Badlapur railway station, an official from the Kalyan GRP said

content: Stressing the need to remove the physical, social, informational, and attitudinal barriers to enable every traveller to explore the world with dignity and independence, Minister Mohamed Riyas reminded that the right to travel safely, comfortably, and with dignity belongs to everyone

content: According to police, two groups of customers, allegedly under the influence of alcohol, entered into a heated argument over the delay in serving food

content: The meteorological department has forecast light to moderate rain or snow, especially in the higher reaches

content: The Economic Survey 2025-26, presented by Chief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran, offers a calm, data-driven assessment of India‚Äôs economic prospects amid global uncertainty.

title: 50 years ago, on this day, for the first time a government was dismissed in Tamil Nadu
content: ‚ÄúThis is the first time that Tamil Nadu has been brought under President‚Äôs Rule. Though the five-year term of the State Assembly was due to expire on March 21, the Centre has taken this action to dissolve it because of the serious situation that has arisen in the State in terms of the Governor‚Äôs report,‚Äù¬†The Hindu‚Äôs New Delhi Correspondent G.K. Reddy reported on the front page of its edition dated February 1, 1976.

title: Blog: Blog | "Hamberder" To "Furniture Of Children", Donald Trump And The Art Of The Vowel
content: Time and again, Donald Trump has proven that he possesses the best words. They just aren't always the ones in the dictionary.

title: Sunetra Pawar Oath Ceremony LIVE Updates: Sunetra Pawar Attends NCP Party Meeting At Vidhan Bhavan
content: Sunetra Pawar Oath Taking Ceremony LIVE Updates: Sunetra Pawar will take oath as Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister today, at 5 pm.

title: Elon Musk Planned To Visit 'Pedo Island', Show Epstein Files
content: Elon Musk's name has surfaced in the latest batch of Jeffrey Epstein files, revealing a 2013 email exchange where the tech billionaire discussed plans to visit Epstein's private island in the Caribbean.

title: Rapido Driver Created Fake Profiles Of Women, Posed As Cop To Extort Money
content: A 27-year-old Rapido driver was arrested for duping people by pretending to be a cybercrime police officer and threatening them for money in Hyderabad on Wednesday.

title: "Wanted To Speak To His Mother": Bengaluru Tycoon's Final Moments In Office
content: Confident Group Chairman Dr CJ Roy died by suicide on Friday, moments after an Income Tax (IT) interrogation linked to ongoing raids on his companies. The incident occurred shortly after Roy told colleagues he wanted to speak with his mother

title: "Corruption Behind Kolkata Warehouse Fire": Amit Shah Slams Mamata Banerjee
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday strongly criticised the Mamata Banerjee government over the devastating fire at the Anandapur warehouses near Kolkata, calling it a result of "corruption" and demanding a thorough probe into the incident.

title: Will NCP Merge With Sharad Pawar Faction? Senior Leader Refutes Claim
content: NCP Maharashtra state president Sunil Tatkare clarified that the January 17 meeting was regarding the local body election and no discussion on merger happened.

title: Big Op Underway In J&K's Kishtwar To Flush Out Jaish Terrorists
content: A fierce gunbattle is underway between security forces and terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district as Operation Trashi-I enters its 14th day.

title: Indore's Viral "Dancing Cop" Demoted After Woman's Allegations
content: Ranjeet Singh, the traffic policeman celebrated nationwide as India's "Dancing Cop," has hit a jarring pause in his once-viral journey.

title: Trump Named In Abuse Claims In Largest-Ever Epstein Document Release
content: Newly released Epstein files include claims of abuse linked to parties at Donald Trump‚Äôs Mar-a-Lago, with the US President named in internal summaries.

title: Sunetra Pawar Can Take Deputy Oath Without Being An MLA, But There's A Rider
content: All portfolios, except for Finance and Planning, previously held by Ajit Pawar, will be given to Sunetra Pawar.

title: "We Go Begging, Our Heads Bow Down In Shame": Pak PM's Big Admission
content: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has openly admitted that he and the country's Army Chief, Field Marshal Asim Munir, had to travel to nations to ask for financial help.

title: 5 Big Railway Reforms Expected In Union Budget 2026
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is set to present the Railway Budget 2026 as part of the Union Budget tomorrow, with expectations centred on safety upgrades, passenger-friendly measures and capacity expansion.

title: Court Rejects Bail Plea Of 3 Accused In Zubeen Garg's Death Case
content: A court sessions court in Guwahati on Friday rejected the bail applications of three key accused in Zubeen Garg's death case, including singer Amritprava Mahanta and two personal security officers of the late artist.

title: Alcohol, Snacks, And A Double Murder By Eatery Staff In Ghaziabad
content: A fight over snacks and alcohol at an eatery in Ghaziabad escalated on Friday, leading to the death of two men and leaving another injured.

title: US Government Shuts Down As Budget Approval Misses Funding Deadline
content: The US government entered a partial shutdown Saturday as a midnight funding deadline passed without Congress approving a 2026 budget.

title: Sharad Pawar's Big Remark On Sunetra Pawar Getting Deputy Post
content: The decision to make Sunetra Pawar Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra was taken by the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and the family was not consulted, said Ajit Pawar's uncle and NCP-SP Chief, Sharad Pawar.

title: Bill Gates Caught STD After Sex With Russian Girls, Claim Epstein Files
content: Among the newly released files are draft emails that appear to have been written by Epstein. The emails include claims accusing Gates of attempting to conceal an STD from his then-wife, following alleged sex with "Russian girls".

title: Satellite Photos Show Activity At Iran Nuclear Sites Amid Protest Crackdown
content: As tensions soar over Iran's crackdown on nationwide protests, satellite images show activity at two Iranian nuclear sites bombed last year by Israel and the US that may be a sign of Tehran trying to obscure efforts to salvage any materials.

title: Filmmaker Mira Nair, Zohran Mamdani's Mother, Mentioned In Epstein Files
content: New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani's mother, Mira Nair, attended an afterparty at convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell's house for her 2009 film "Amelia", reveals a new set of Epstein files.

title: 2026 UGC equity rules: Cracks on campus
content: Students from the general category or upper castes believe that the UGC‚Äôs 2026 regulations, introduced mainly to address caste discrimination on campuses, will create a divide and villainise them. They worry about several of its provisions, including the lack of protection against false complaints. While the Supreme Court has stayed the regulations, anger has not yet subsided, report Abhinay Lakshman and Mayank Kumar

title: NC‚Äôs MP Ramzan meets Palestinian Minister in Delhi, expresses solidarity
content: The NC spokesman said Dr. Aghabekian on January 29 briefed the attendees on the current political developments and the prevailing ground and humanitarian situation in Palestine

title: BJP MLA confronts U.P. Minister over delayed water projects in Mahoba, video went viral
content: After the video of the incident went viral, the Samajwadi Party (SP) president Akhilesh Yadav targeted the BJP government, alleging that BJP ministers or MLAs are busy making money and grabbing land, with none of them are working for the public or for development needs.

title: Challenges stacked against Sunetra Pawar, who will take charge in a turbulent political scenario, amid a flux in two parties
content: For the NCP, it is now a battle for survival, where the legislators and cadres will not find any other face acceptable as a leadership option

title: Indian-origin printing firm boss convicted of COVID loan fraud in U.K.
content: Prashant Jobanputra is said to have ‚Äúfraudulently declared‚Äù on the second application that this was the only Bounce Back Loan he had applied for.

content: When the House reassembled, Mr. Jully requested that a half-hour discussion on the allegations of SIR irregularities be allowed in the light of a debate on electoral reforms held in Lok Sabha recently.

title: A soldier few know, a record few can match: Brigadier Henry Bhaskar‚Äôs journey through two wars and beyond
content: A frontline officer in the 1965 and 1971 wars, Brigadier Bhaskar went on to become the first chairman of the Chittagong Port Trust in newly liberated Bangladesh after leading Indian troops into the strategic harbour city

title: When the sea became a shared responsibility for scientists and people living along the coast
content: Over the past two decades, INCOIS‚Äôs Wave Monitoring Along Nearshore (WAMAN) buoy network has been transforming India‚Äôs coastal forecasting by combining science with community trust. With 17 nearshore buoys and active local participation, WAMAN delivers real-time wave data that strengthens early warnings, supports fishers and ports, and ensures long-term, sustainable ocean observation

title: AI171 crash probe: AAIB assessing various aspects; nothing has been ruled out, says source
content: According to a report on January 30, the probe might be leaning towards deliberate pilot action as the probable cause for the accident

title: How can State government squat on private property, asks Madras High Court Chief Justice

content: Sources say the interviews have created a buzz among the aspirants, who have had a chance to meet with the leadership and speak about their work within the party

title: Roy and his love for Rolls Royce
content: The businessman found dead on Friday was an avid luxury cars enthusiast, often posting about them on his social media account

title: Confident Group was one of the first to move into Sarjapur
content: Owner C.J. Roy, who shot himself to death, had turned the fate to his favor by acquiring over 300 acres land much before real estate boom in Bengaluru

title: Supreme Court sets aside Madras HC order asking accused to marry for bail
content: Advocates representing the accused-petitioner submitted before the apex court that asking their client to actually marry the woman, even before the charges were proved against him, would amount to pre-judging the allegation that he had made the promise of wedlock

title: Uttarakhand-like attacks forcing Kashmir youth to look inwards: Omar Abdullah

content: The detainee reportedly confessed to his involvement in trafficking Bangladeshi nationals through different border routes

title: 2-year Central deputation at SP/DIG level must for IPS officers to be eligible for senior posts: MHA
content: The MHA writes to States that a minimum of two years of Central experience at SP/DIG or equivalent level will be mandatory for empanelment of IPS officers at IG/equivalent level at the Centre from the 2011 batch onwards.

content: These observations of the Supreme Court coupled with its refusal to entertain a plea seeking minimum wages for domestic workers, are deeply concerning, the AITUC said

title: Samyukt Kisan Morcha set to campaign against India-EU trade deal
content: The opening of the processed food market will have a larger and disastrous impact on domestic agricultural production and small farmers, the Samyukt Kisan Morcha says in a statement

title: Resurvey 2.0 should be error free, says A.P. Revenue Minister
content: Minister says government has extended timeline to 140 days to allow thorough verification, instructs officials to actively involve landowners at every stage and defer surveys if farmers concerned are not present

content: The decision comes amid growing protests by Kannada activists in Bengaluru and other parts of the state who have recently been removing tobacco-related advertisements from RTC buses.

title: WWE 'SmackDown': Live results and analysis
content: The go-home "SmackDown" ahead of the Royal Rumble ended in chaos, potentially a sign of things to come on Saturday at Royal Rumble. Drew McIntyre dragged Sami Zayn out of the ring during an 8-man tag main event featuring The Vision challenging Zayn, Cody Rhodes, Randy Orton and Jey Uso, which led to a DQ. Jacob Fatu joined the fun and attacked McIntyre, with& Bron Breakker closing "SmackDown" by spearing Rhodes and Zayn. Earlier in the show, Carmelo Hayes defended his United States Championship against Rey Fenix in an open challenge match, AJ Styles and Gunther traded verbal jabs on the mic, and the team of Charlotte Flair and Alexa Bliss defeated Liv Morgan and Roxanne Perez from The Judgement Day. Arda Ocal broke down all the action from "SmackDown" in Riyadh.
